ast.name: Win Lotto
ast.comment:
Overview:
This is a very basic 'scratchy' based lottery app. It is not completely functional, as there are some bizarre or entirely missing calculations for wins. Otherwise, and besides eye catching designs, it works completely.

IMPORTANT: This script is actually based on another chain of scripts that belong to me, the latest at: www.touchdevelop.com/aucl

There was an issue that was preventing the script from running on Windows Phone, and the resolution ended up being duplicating the code directly rather than the entire script.

All of the code in this script is my own work. It was mostly based on trial and error to learn what functions do what, and what others caused problems.

The only part of this script that does not belong to me are the symbols used. They were taken from Microsoft Office Webdings or Wingdings as images.

There was, however, a minor issue that was resolved fairly early on with the help of the community, and aided in my learning. Multiple commenters pointed out that this was the cause of an error I was having early on.

Features:
*Randomly generated scratchy tickets. A total of 12 symbols with a range of monetary values according to weight.
*'Reverse Side' instructions. See the basic game instructions by clicking 'Instructions', and return to your scratching by clicking 'Back'. This is a little more realistic than having instructions in the 'main menu'
*Available funds. More specifically: current balance, balance deductions on ticket purchases (from $1-$5), inappropriate additions when a win is actually calculated, and a 'cheat' feature to add another $10 to current balance.
*Tickets cannot be saved for later. In order to return to the main menu, you must completely reveal the game panel and check for a winning ticket. At this point it may or may not alter your available balance, and you are returned to the menu screen.
*The symbol counter collection does not function correctly. Issues arise when resetting it after or before a game, and the total of the counters end up out of bounds if they are not reset. This does not cause any crashes.

Future Potential:
Aside from fixing the

body.text: All of the actual code in this script is original and my own work.
A lot more text and picture sprites used to create the 'reverse side' instructions. A lot of alignment finetuning involved to attempt a scalable approach.
This action basically just sets up all of the symbol art in a sprite array (symbolsList) so they can be duplicated for scratchy generation
First set is for game symbol generation
Adding game panel sprites to a collection
For each symbol there is a corresponding monetary value
Hide the original sprites and create a counter position for each symbol in symbolCount
A greater design change was not implemented. This has not affected the basic premise of the app and would only offer a more eye pleasing experience.
generatedSymbolSet - stores all symbols for a specific game instance
symbolMaskSet - stores scratch panel sections for each symbol position
Creating 4 x 3 scratch panel
There are currently 16 symbols set up for random generation
Adds the last generated symbol to an array (for when prize checking is implemented)
Symbol masks form the scratch panel, and will later be replaced with designs
Each symbol mask section is added to an array so it can be 'scratched' section by section
Each symbolMask is currently hidden for development purposes ('scratching' a section will yield no visible results)
All of this simply creates text sprites and positions them appropriately for a menu screen

This forms a somewhat random method of selecting symbols, weighted slightly by their value and significance. The lower value symbols generally have a broader range, and the higher value ones a far narrower range. This means that the odds of getting multiples of the higher symbols are exponentially smaller than multiples of any other lower symbols, and is a small step towards realistic odds.
When grey mask is tapped, reveal symbol behind it
Simply a cheat/shortcut to add more funds to your balance

thenBody.text: Checks that your balance is higher than the cost of the ticket you selected, and proceeds to 'purchase' it if true. i.e. deduct cost of ticket and display scratchy

body.text: A simple balance check displayed through a prompt
If 'Check Win' is touched, check for a winning ticket only if all symbols have been revealed, otherwise continue.
Flips the ticket to display the 'instructions' side
A back button to switch from the instructions board to the scratchy board

decls.name: symbolPrizes
decls.comment: List of prize values per symbol

body.text: Incomplete functionality. Used to calculate the win amount in dollars of the current ticket. Reliance on another incomplete feature is partly the reason it is incomplete.
Where there are 3 or more of any given symbol on the scratch panel, count them towards the win total by multiplying their quantity by monetary value by ticket value.
This unnecessarily long action is used by createInstructionsPanel to place the symbol art and their values in appropriate positions between the description and example.
This action sets up the three game boards, and all the collections that are used.
Add ticket prices $1-$5 for different ticket values
Starting balance for the game
